intro: Diplopterys lucida, commonly known as the golden cupuaçu, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a unique fruit that contains a high concentration of lipids and antioxidants. It is often found growing along riverbanks and in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and potential medicinal research.
